column2: U.S. Drug Price Reform Targets Global Pharma Giants
column5: President Trump signed an executive order mandating pharmaceutical companies to propose significant U.S. drug price reductions within 30 days, threatening tariffs and further actions if targets aren't met. This move impacts major firms like AstraZeneca and GSK, which rely heavily on U.S. revenues. Analysts anticipate legal challenges and implementation complexities.
column8: GSK and AstraZeneca take hit as Trump vows to make drugs cheaper

column2: WHO Reports Progress Amid Financial Uncertainties
column5: The World Health Organization's 2024 Results Report indicates advancements in global health goals despite financial challenges. The report highlights improvements in areas such as disease prevention and healthcare access, underscoring resilience in global health initiatives.
column8: Healthcare News - Medical and Health News

column2: Global Regulators Prioritize Climate Risk Assessment
column5: The Basel Committee on Banking Supervision announced plans to enhance the assessment of financial risks related to climate change. A voluntary disclosure framework is set to guide national regulators, aligning with European and British strategies. However, the U.S. has withdrawn from several climate-focused initiatives, indicating a regulatory divergence.
column8: Global banking regulators agree to prioritise climate risk work

column2: Japanese Investment Aids Indian Bank Recovery
column5: Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (SMBC) is acquiring a 20% stake in India's Yes Bank for $1.58 billion, marking the largest cross-border investment in an Indian bank. This move is expected to strengthen governance and attract more global capital to India's banking sector.
column8: SMBC to acquire 20% of India’s Yes Bank in $1.6bn deal

column2: TD Bank to Close 38 U.S. Branches Amid Digital Shift
column5: TD Bank announced the closure of 38 branches across ten U.S. states, reflecting a broader industry trend toward digital banking. The shift is driven by changing customer behaviors and cost-reduction strategies.
column8: TD Bank closing 38 locations in ten states as Americans face major changes

column2: JP Morgan Enhances Green Banking Leadership in Europe
column5: JP Morgan appointed Kai-Christian Nerger as head of green economy banking for Europe, aiming to assist clients in reducing carbon emissions and capitalizing on green opportunities. This appointment reinforces the bank's commitment to supporting the energy transition and climate technology sectors.
column8: JP Morgan creates new green banking leadership role
